author: Special Correspondent
text:
Collector M. Karunakaran inaugurated renovation of the road connecting Tirunelveli Town Arch and Kurukkuthurai Road on Monday.

Though the new road was formed with the objective of easing traffic congestion around Swamy Nellaiyappar Temple a few months ago by acquiring land from the owner, a case filed with the Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption stalled the progress and no blacktopping was provided after blue metal was spread on the stretch.

Trouble to road users

Since the dusty and uneven surface gave a lot of problems to road users, it was decided to provide blacktopping on the road.

Subsequently, Dr. Karunakaran inaugurated the exercise on Monday in the presence of MPs S. Muthukaruppan and Vijila Sathyananth, Tirunelveli MLA Nainar Nagenthran, Tirunelveli Revenue Divisional Officer P. Fermi Vidhya, Commissioner S. Sivasubramanian, Deputy Mayor P. Jeganathan alias Ganesan and City Engineer V. Narayanan Nair.

The 700-metre-long and 50-foot-wide road will be given blacktopping on an outlay of Rs. 58 lakh.
